title: The boards defends jhin and complains about cait
body:
Shows on how much they understand about the game.

Jhin is too strong at all phases of the game, hes strong early mid late and has utility AND more effective range than caitlyn.

Out of every adc why does board has to defend one of the most overloaded adcs?

For reference (plat and above stats) :

Cait pick rate : 17%
Cait win rate : 48%

Jhin pick rate : 55%
Jhin win rate : 52%

When people say he's immobile they neglect to realize actual immobile champions (ie; kog'maw) that have NO access to mobility whatsoever. I'm not gonna talk about High Elo, as that's a place I'd rather stay away from, but from an enemy point of view, I'd rather play against Jhin than Caitlyn. Granted, I'd also rather rip my own toenails off, make soup out of it and drink it through my eyeballs rather than play against Caitlyn.
Her laning is extremely oppresive, while Jhin has defined weak moments and counterplay. Sure Cait may have some too, but they kind of go under in her lane-bully identity. He may be very strong at the moment and in the past, but that's a question of numbers, not design.
Also, I believe most of his pick rate stems from how fun and rewarding it feels to play him. I don't get that when playing Caitlyn.

Anyways, you're kinda comparing apples with oranges: While there may be problems with Jhin, they're not the same as Caitlyns. What most threads about Caitlyn complain about is how unfun and oppressive she is to play against. Jhins main problem is that he's just too strong with current items/the inherent synergy with them in his kit. Caitlyns issues stem from her design, Jhins from his overall numbers.
